p: Toxic influenza is extremely rare, which is caused by invasion of influenza virus into the central nervous system and cardiovascular system, with manifestations of toxic symptoms. Clinically, the symptoms are characterized by encephalitis or meningitis, including high fever, coma, delirium, and convulsion. Some serious symptoms may be found such as cerebral meningeal irritation and disseminated intravascular coagulation. Toxic influenza has a high mortality rate.
